name: Mini Pizza "Cupcakes"
author: Ashley Bluth
summary: These pizza "cupcakes" might just be a perfect food. The outsides are like garlic bread and the insides are full of oozing cheese.
ingredients: ¾ cup shredded mozzarella cheese, or to taste
1 (6 ounce) package sliced pepperoni, or to taste
2 cups marinara sauce, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Spray a 24-cup mini muffin tin with cooking spray
Roll pizza dough on a lightly floured surface into a 12x18-inch rectangle
Use a pizza cutter to slice dough into 24 squares
Place mozzarella cheese and pepperoni slices on each square; you'll need to be able to enclose the toppings in the dough so keep that in mind
Carefully lift up each square and wrap dough around toppings
Pinch to seal shut and place seam-side down in the prepared muffin cups
Brush the tops of the dough balls with olive oil, then sprinkle with Italian seasoning and garlic powder
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 10 minutes
Meanwhile, heat marinara sauce in a saucepan over medium-low heat
Remove pizza "cupcakes" from the oven and serve with warm marinara on the side for dipping
